schema.name: project name/title
schema.last-commit: if build avalable: date of last commit on master. else: leave blank
schema.progress: stage of project. plan(light orange)=planning stage -> dev(blue)=in development -> prod(green)=build available -> dep(red)=not maintained

demo.tab: boolean value if demo is deployed separate

projects.name: JWT Authentication Service
projects.description: Deployed a Node.js server that utilizes JSON Web Tokens to handle the creation, validation, and decoding of secure, self-contained tokens that are used for authentication and authorization. The microservice uses safety measures to defend against common security threats and data validation to ensure that only valid data is accepted and processed. It functions as a reliable and secure authentication system that can be easily integrated into other web applications or APIs.

projects.name: URL shortener
projects.description: A lightweight, isolated Node.js microservice built using TypeScript and the Express.js framework that generates short and neat URLs. The service is available to the public via an API to generate random short URLs and is continually being updated to add new features like analytics, user-defined short URLs, password-protected short URLs, etc. while also making sure it continues to be reliable, scalable and effective for its users.

projects.name: GPU Price Scrapper
projects.description: A CRON job that is scheduled to run on a Node.js server on a daily basis at fixed time. The job fetches GPU prices from popular retailer online stores and saves them to a MySQL database. The database is controlled using Prisma ORM. The script also makes use of libraries such as node-html-parser and axios to retrieve and parse the scraped data. It also incorporates error handling mechanisms, logging, and monitoring to ensure that everything runs seamlessly and without disruptions. It was designed to retrieve the latest prices on a daily basis, making it useful for monitoring and analyzing price trends, and making informed purchasing decisions.

projects.name: Hospital database management system
projects.description: As part of a course, I built a PHP web application that connected to a MySQL database. The app was designed to manage and visualise data about hospitals, doctors, patients, and their relationships. The application has a user-friendly interface that allows users to easily view and manage data. This project provided me with a fantastic opportunity to put my PHP and MySQL skills to use and create a real-world application.

projects.name: Aperture
projects.description: Full-stack photo sharing platform to-be developed using Deno. Will initially serve as a learning experience into Deno and Fresh frameworks but will evolve to be a standalone full-stack application

projects.name: MapPic
projects.description: At a hackathon, I was part of a team that created a MEVN stack web application that allows users to find and mark new locations for photographic spots around town, leveraging Google Cloud Vision API for image recognition and tagging and Vue.js for a modular front-end design, resulting in a user-friendly and efficient tool.

extra.name: ValTMs
extra.description: Online hub to organize and track professional level Valorant custom games.
